The goal of the game is to collect a set of 4 identical Hot Wheels rides; each player is limited to a hand of 4 cards, from which they simultaneously exchange any cards they wish from their hand, one card at a time, for any card on the table, including cards discarded by other players in the same round.

Name: Neteru
Description:
The sister game to Junishi, 12 Moons and Zodiakos,
Neteru is an abstract strategy game inspired by the 12 signs of the Egyptian Zodiac. (Each player controls 6 of the 12 signs.)

The object of Neteru is to move one of your 6 pieces into your opponent's Gate, which is located at the opposite end of the board, in between your opponent's Spawn Areas.

Players begin at either end of a board comprised of 23 circles. 
At the start of the game there are not any pieces on the board. Any pieces that a player wishes to use must be "spawned" in one of the Spawn Circles on that player's side of the board. 
Players may move the pieces that they already have on the board either by moving them into adjacent circles or by jumping over friendly pieces.
Players also may use their animals to capture their opponent's animals by jumping over them.

Neteru is a simple and fast paced abstract strategy game that is easy to learn and usually plays in under 20 minutes. It comes in a little cloth bag that also serves as the game board
and it can be carried in any pocket that is big enough to hold a pack of gum.

Neteru is a complete game that can be expanded by combining it with its sister games Junishi, 12 Moons, and Zodiakos.
(source : the publisher)

Integrates with:

    12 Moons



    Junishi



    Zodiakos

Name: Wi$eMoney
Description:
Wi$eMoney is a fun learning game for students. It reduces lectures, puts teachers in a role to reinforce learning, and facilitates discussions on personal finance through problem-based learning to keep students involved and active.
Player teams compete by answering questions on banking, investing, budgeting, planning, financing, credit, and safety and identify protection and by making financial choices to distinguish between needs and wants.

Components:

     Game board
     Cards and game elements

Name: BattleTech: ComStar
Description:
From the back of the book:

"As the Star League was dying on the eve of the Succession Wars, the House Lords agreed on one final action. At the suggestion of General Kerensky they appointed Jerome Blake as Minister of Communications and charged him with repairing the damaged HPG network. This would prove a momentous decision.

Within a few short years after Kerensky's Exodus, Blake and his followers had seized control of Terra and declared themselves neutral in the coming conflicts. The newly-named ComStar evolved into a pseudo-religious organization, with Blake as its divine founder, that positioned itself as the keeper of technology and the preserver of humanity's future.

For nearly 300 years, ComStar watched as the Succession Wars ripped apart the Inner Sphere and technology was lost, waiting for the day when they would step in to save humanity from a new dark age. But the 31st century changed all of that.

This sourcebook presents the history and inner workings of ComStar, including the devastating schism that struck the sect in the days following their victory over the Clans at Tukayyid."

User comment:

This sourcebook is largely background detail provided in much the same format as the earlier background books such as House Steiner: The Lyran Commonwealth or The Periphery although it runs up to 3055 rather than 3025. This sourcebook includes details of the Nexus, Raijin and Grand Crusader 'Mechs, which were reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3058.

Name: Tastomino
Description:
This is a Dominoes variant with two ways of playing. The first one follows regular Dominoes rules: A player can play a tile on his/her turn which must match a tile to another tile at one end of the layout of tiles already on the table. If the player cannot do that with a tile s/he owns, s/he has to draw an additional tile. The first player to get rid of his/her tiles is the winner.

The playing pieces however, are irregularly shaped. For the second variant, the players put their pieces into a bag and have to feel which edge fits an edge of another piece. Other than that, the usual rules apply as well.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Wiewiórka Spryciulka
Description: A push your luck with squirrels game for children! Each turn the active player throws 8 boxes. If none of the boxes fell with the open side up the player ends his turn. If he threw at least one box on it's open side up he puts the nut that was inside the box in front of him. Now he can either end his turn and gain all the nuts he has in front of him or risk and throw with all the remaining boxes. And now: if none of the boxes have their open side up - he loses all the nuts he put in font of him this turn. Otherwise he takes the nuts from the boxes with their open side up and once again decides whether he wants to risk another throw or gain all the nuts he has in front of him. The first player to gain 2 sets of 4 nuts in one colour wins!

Name: Befuzzled
Description:
Think Quick, Act Faster!

Will you be the first to say "Arrrr!" like a pirate when a circle appears?  Or clap your hands at the sight of dots?  Don't cheer "Hooray!" for a square though...that was last round.

Players take turns flipping over cards which show different shapes.  Be the first to complete the correct action and you win that card!  But watch out - each round shuffles the actions, and their matching shapes.  You score a point for each card awarded, and at the end of the game the player with the most points wins!

Contains 24 action cards, 8 shape cards and 40 flip cards.

Name: Psiduel
Description:
Psiduel is an intense, psychological dueling game for two players. Players take the role of psionic test subjects, pitted against one another in an "experiment" only one of them can survive. It is visceral and fast; playable in under 15 minutes.

At the beginning of a game, each player prepares a grid consisting of six cards face down. This grid represents the player’s psionic defenses. The card backs display a number from one to three, letting the opponent know the strength of the defense, but not the type.

Each player has an offense and defense deck to draw from. During a round, players burn cards off the top of a deck in order to play cards from their hand, either to replenish their defenses or attack.

The object of the game is to destroy your opponent’s defenses, and reduce them to zero life by attacking unoccupied spaces on their grid.

72 cards (2 decks of 36, one for each player) and a simple rule sheet come in the box. No add-ons required.

Name: Non-Stop Safari
Description:
Non-Stop Safari is a 2 to 4 player print and play board game submission to the 2011 Global Game Jam. Players take on the role of rich financiers who send hunters on safari to find valuable animal pelts. Only the rarest pelts will fetch the highest price, and you can’t get more rare than extinct! By hunting a species to extinction players can guarantee a high return on their precious pelts. Oh, and watch out for poachers, unless of course, they’re working for you!

The object of the game is to be the player with the most money by the end of the game. The game ends immediately after the third species has gone extinct. All pelts of this species are sold off as usual and then money totals are counted.

Name: Sovereign: An open source board game project
Description:
The main objective of the game is to collect seven of one type of victory card. Players must balance their play between researching technologies, expanding cities and building units. Having only a limited number of actions per turn, it is important for players to consider their activities carefully so that they maximize their ability to collect cards. The first player to collect seven of one type of victory card wins the game.

This game is based on hex-grid map boards and players can choose which sections of the map to assemble. Currently there are maps of Europe and the Caribbean, although plans for future maps will cover the entire world. Players lay tiles down to form cities and can build military units to protect them or attack others. Cities create the wealth that a player needs to further their empire.

Players take turns to perform their moves, building their empire up while keeping a close eye on their neighbors to prevent them beating them to the end. Open play allows players to watch other players activities, and manage resources in way that can stop other players winning while not hindering their own advancement.

The game has been designed to give flexibility to the rules so that players can develop in-house versions of the rules without breaking the game. One popular alteration is in the collection of cards. Players can change the speed and dynamic of the game by changing how many and of which types of card need to be collected.

The game is fully customizable allowing players to design their own versions including army units, maps, technologies and rules. The online published version of the game can be downloaded and printed off for free.

Released under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike licence.

Name: Bio Grafo The Biography Game of Skill and Chance
Description:
75 well-known authors and one work each is known for is the basis of this Bingo-type 'educational' game. Each player gets one of 40 'GRAFO' cards, a 5 by 5 grid where each square has an author number, an author's name, and his or her image. The caller randomly pulls from the stock of 75 tokens, and reads aloud the column letter (G, R, A, F, or O) and title of a play, book, poem, or short story and optionally the author number. If the author of that work is on his or her card, a player marks that square with a translucent disk, hoping to be the first to get five in a row. Can be played in three difficulty levels:

1) Playing by the numbers. The caller reads the column letter, title, and author number. This makes the game no harder than Bingo with some trivia thrown in.

2) Playing by the book. The caller omits the author number, but players have access to a "Bio/graphics" booklet in which they can find the author of the named work.

3) Playing for mastery. Players no longer have access to the book and have to recall from memory the author of the named work.

A player calls "Grafo" when he or she covers five squares in a row on his or her card, and once verified is declared the winner.

Name: Milky Way Express
Description:
Milky Way Express is a Free Print-and-Play space trading and exploration game.

Game Summary
You start the game with a credit of $10 and your aim is to earn enough money throughout the game to pay back this loan when the game ends.
You will take turns moving your Spaceship on cards laid out as a chart of the Milky Way Galaxy, discovering new Planets as you go. You will throw dice to determine what goods will be on offer at each planet. Available goods will vary from turn to turn, so buy low and sell high while the market is friendly to you. But if luck abandons you, you may be driven to Bankruptcy by greedy Pirates and zealous Customs controls (if you dare to smuggle any illegal goods).
The game ends when you turn over the last unexplored card on the Galactic Chart, or when you run out of money.

This game is released under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License - that means you can use and modify the game for free, but you can't sell it or claim it as your own.

Name: Valley Forge II: A Supplement to Valley Forge
Description:
Information compiled from the website tomeoftreasures.com with information from the designer.

This game is essentially an "errata section" for TSR's game Valley Forge, a game released at GenCon for the 1976 Bi-Centennial.  However, this game product was self-published by the designer Dave Wesely as he was being called into the US Army.  He hired former TSR employee David R. Megarry to work out the details.  Combined with Valley Forge, this provides 44 pages of tactical rules.

Some copies were sold bundled with TSR's Valley Forge.

Name: Jakten på guldmynten
Description:
Jakten på guldmynten (The hunt for the goldcoins) is a dice game with characters from Disney, like Scrooge McDuck. You want to be the first player to achieve 10.000 points.

You roll 10 dices, and attempt to get dice with "pairs", like Donald, Daisy and Gladstone Gander (they have the same colour, red), you get a bonus, and also you can now roll the "coin-dice" trying to get a coin worth 1000 points. But without getting three dices with the faces of Beagle Boys. Dice with a star is a joker.

The game is similar to Monopoly Express.

Name: Anglin Action
Description:
When you get the urge to fish but can't launch the boat.... Here's the solution.

Anglin' Action is a game that involves matching fish with their correct location and lures. This allows a player to 'catch' the fish. All of the fish are assigned different values. 
The winner is the player with the most 'fish points' at the end of the game.

Playing the Game:

Deal five action cards to each player.
Pile the remaining Action Cards, Lure Cards and Location Cards at the side of the table.

There are three simple phases that make up a player's turn:

Draw Phase: Draw one card from the game deck
Action Phase: You may play an Action Card if you want. Simply follow th einstructions on the Action Card. Limit one per turn.
Fish Phase: On this phase a player may do ONE of three things:

Move to a location- Take a location card and place in front of you.
Put on a lure- Take a lure card from your tackle box and place in front of you.
Catch a fish- Take a fish from your hand that matches the correct lure and correct location you are in.

Afteryour fishing phase is over the next player goes.

Winning:

The game ends when any player has caught their limit of ten fish. At this point the winner is determined by the player with the most points. Therefore the player who caught ten fish may not necessarily be the winner of the game.

Name: Killzone 2
Description:
Killzone 2 is a cardgame made by a fan of the Playstation 3 game called Killzone 2. It's a two player game, for free on the web. One player takes control of ISA (human) army, the other player is Helghast. The goal is to destroy enemy. There are two 63-card decks. In the first round, every players draw 6 cards. If they have at least 2 basic cards (soldiers and shock troopers), the battle begin.In each round, player draws one card and heals character for 10 points. Every round you have 10 Action Points and you can use them to:

-attack
-place basic character in spawn point
-evolve character (example= soldier can evolve to any V1 character [medic, saboteur etc.] or in soldier v2)
-place vechiles
-equip weapons, tools
-use tools

You can have:

1 Active Character
5 Spawn Point Characters
Vechile, Weapon, Tool

If enemy haven't got any characters on spawn point or in active character place, you win!

Name: Geronimo
Description:
One player rolls five dice (each side of the die bearing a different color). The result is called "Geronimo". All players will ante chips into the pot. Each player will then ante another chip and then attempt to match the Geronimo. If three of the five dice match, he may reroll the remaining two. If one of the two match, he may then take a third roll of the remaining die. If the dice match the Geronimo, the player wins the pot. During play, other combinations of dice may win the player lesser rewards from the pot.

The game is over when the pot is exhausted and the winner has the most chips.

Name: Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea
Description:
Bombers at War: The Battle of the Bismarck Sea is a companion game to Airships at War, 3rd Edition.

The rules allow for the addition of WW2-era aircraft and naval vessels to the Airships at War world.

The game comes with 20 new phase cards, 16 new planes, 14 scenarios, and campaign rules.

Name: BattleTech: Jade Falcon Sourcebook
Description:
From the back of the book:

"From the unknown regions of the Periphery, they came to conquer.

When they first arrived in the Federated Commonwealth, no one knew who these mysterious invaders were. Soon, Clan Jade Falcon became a name to be feared. They seemed completely unstoppable. They piloted strange new 'Mechs. Their armored infantry, nicknamed "Toads" by their stunned opponents, were unlike anything seen before. They nearly killed the heir to the throne.

This ComStar document details the history and development of Clan Jade Falcon from their beginnings in the chaos of the Exodus Civil War to the battlefields of Tukayyid. Contains a complete roster of the invading Jade Falcon forces, along with personality profiles of prominent officers."

User comment:

Providing a counterpoint to the BattleTech: Wolf Clan sourcebook, the Jade Falcon sourcebook gives a crusader-faction viewpoint on some events before delving into the Jade Falcon part in the invasion of the Inner Sphere. Largely useful for background reference in use in MechWarrior, or in forming campaign scnearios for BattleTech/BattleForce. It also provided profiles for four new BattleMechs - the Baboon, Hellhound, Kraken and Vixen, which were reprinted in the BattleTech Technical Readout: 3055 Upgrade a decade later.

Name: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum
Description: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum official trivia board game! Test your rock and roll knowledge and travel 86 spaces to become the first player to reach the Hall of Fame. Includes over 1,700 questions and clues about the greatest people, events, recordings and dates in rock and roll history!

Name: Trade Fleet
Description:
The golden age of sail was funded by the mighty trade fleets of the World’s nations. In this card game you will control a fleet of ships, trying to amass as much gold as possible.

Collect goods and when you have enough trade them in at a port. Maybe you want to waylay other captians with dock fees or get them lost? Remeber, the pirates weren't the riches men on the seas, the traders were.

Players have several different play options each turn including playing a card, playing a port or redeeming goods. By redeeming goods at a port players earn gold which is required to win the game.

Name: Dragon Egg Omelet
Description:
A simple push-your-luck dice game, Dragon Egg Omelet (or Omelette, depending on where one lives) tasks players with searching dragon nests to collect eggs required in a very rare omelet for an ornery king (with quite a specific culinary palate).

Try to gather the necessary dragon eggs before the other players without rousing the adult dragons who guard those eggs.

Components: 6 dice, 40 dragon eggs, instructions, portable carrying case.

Gameplay involves rolling sets of dragon eggs (pips) with the dice, avoiding the faces that display dragons, and pushing your luck to gain eggs and decide whether to continue rolling for more eggs or play it safe and quit for the round.

Name: Dice BattleShips with Land n Air 07
Description:
The game is played on a board like a large chess board, The game board included is just an example You make a board to suit the battle.

The pieces are regular dice d6. The are three different colors that represent Navy (blue), Army (green), Air Force (white). As you play your troops will suffer casualties , You rotate the dice to reduce the strength of a piece.

The object of the game is to control the board, or to eliminate the enemy. You move your troops by aiding each other -- Navy can transport Army, Air Force planes can air-lift Army, Air Force planes can land on carriers, et c.

Game-play is simply
When a unit is adjacent to an enemy unit in your turn you may attack, an attack is resolved by adding all the strengths of the attacking units in the battle, then subtracting the combined enemy strength to reach a positive or negative battle-score. The attacker and defender roll a d6 for further support and add or subtract the numbers from the battle-score total.  A positive result allows the attacker to reduce the enemy force by that number, and a negative battle-score allows the defending player to do the same.

At the beginning of every turn, a d6 is rolled, this gives the current player one of six combat advantages:
1) bomb any land unit and reduce by 2.
2) move any unit by 3
3) add 1 to every combat this turn
4) build a friendly airfield , next to ant land unit
5) fighter attack reduce any plane unit by 2
6) hide any unit for 2 turns

The game also includes optional rules for mines.

Name: Thunderstone: Promo Pack
Description:
This Pack contains:

Blade Trap (Trap-Death)
It destroys the Hero card in your hand with the lowest strength. It also forces the other players to reveal the top two cards from their decks and all revealed Hero cards are destroyed except those with the highest strength.

Death Sentinel (Doomknight-Guardian)
Using the Guardian rules found in Wrath of the Elements, this promo provides another "boss" character to prevent players from obtaining the Thunderstone without first defeating a powerful enemy.

Harruli (Hero)
The level 1 and 2 adds 1/2 attack +1/2 per revealed spell. Level 3 adds 4 attack and allows you to draw three cards and add one spell cards to your hand.

Mammoth (Evil Druid-Familiar)
You may not attack other evil druids while this card is in play. The Mammoth gets a +2 health bonus for each evil druid card in the dungeon.

The Vision (Cultist-Humanoid)
The Vision gains +2 health for each revealed hero and destroys one card with a light value.

Only 4000 sets will be available.

Name: WWE DVD Board Game (3rd Edition)
Description:
From the back of the box:

"Take control of WWE!

Experience a revolution in DVD game play with a new level of interaction between players. Manage the ultimate roster and prepare for unpredictable action as the on-screen General Manager calls the shots. Features incredible 3D graphics, authentic video footage, photos of Superstars and Legends, and unlimited game play"

Object of the game is to collect 4 of the 7 Championship Titles. Each Superstar can only hold one Title at a time. You need 4 Superstars to win the game.

Game-play is roll and move. Roll a die, move that many spaces clockwise, follow the instructions in the space you land, mostly by clicking the corresponding button in the DVD to find out if you have a match, an on-screen challenge or special choice.

Re-implements:

    WWE DVD Board Game (2nd Edition)

Name: Revelations
Description:
Hilarious party game for 5-10 adult players. No matter what the truth is Revelations will reveal the sins, but exactly who the sinners are will remain stricly private! You should expect to have some hilarious and lively discussions as you try to work out how many of your friends have, for example, been caught shoplifting.

The object of this game is to guess the number of your fellow players who have commited each "sin" but exactly who has commited the sin will remain a secret! This game is not really suitable for children as some of the questions are a little on the risky side....but it will provide hours of amusing fun for groups of open minded adults and is a superb party game!
